abstract.text: Represents an asynchronous unit of work.

inlineContent.text: The type of data the unit of work will produce if it succeeds.
All units of work have the potential of throwing an error, because they can all be canceled

abstract.text: Assigns the output of an asynchronous unit of work to a key path on an object.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times while applying a transformation on error.
Catches a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided closure.
Transforms a
value emitted by the current
into its underlying success or failure.
Transforms the error produced by the asynchronous unit of work.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times while applying a transformation on error.
Executes the task with an optional task priority and waits for the result.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs.
Introduces a breakpoint into the asynchronous unit of work.
Zips the result of the current unit of work with three other asynchronous units of work.
The result of the operation (will execute the task)
Transforms the successful output of the upstream
using a provided key path.
A subject that emits a single value or an error.
Adds a behavior to the unit of work that asserts no failures are emitted.

and handles them using the provided throwing closure.

among multiple downstream subscribers.
